etymologies: late 17th century (as a verb): from French, literally ‘small park (i.e. delineated area)’. The noun dates from the early 19th century

definitions: flooring composed of wooden blocks arranged in a geometric pattern

examples.text: do not lay parquet over old vinyl flooring

shortDefinitions: flooring composed of wooden blocks arranged in geometric pattern

definitions: the ground floor of a theater or auditorium.
shortDefinitions: ground floor of theatre or auditorium

definitions: (in France and French-speaking countries) the branch of the administration of the law that deals with the prosecution of crime.
shortDefinitions: (in France and French-speaking countries) branch of administration of law that deals with prosecution of crime
